greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n >= 1} G_n/n^2, where G_n are Gregory's coefficients.
comment: Gregory's coefficients (A002206 and A002207) are also known as (reciprocal) logarithmic numbers, Bernoulli numbers of the second kind and Cauchy numbers of the first kind. First few coefficients are G_1=+1/2, G_2=-1/12, G_3=+1/24, G_4=-19/720, etc.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: Equals integral_{x=0..1} (li(1+x) - gamma - log(x))/x dx, where li(x) is the integral logarithm.
results.author: _Iaroslav V. Blagouchine_, Mar 24 2016
